TextSection.Contents: A rare group of endocrine disorders caused by prolonged and high exposure levels to glucocorticoids of endogenous (adrenal cortex production) origin. Typical clinical features are truncal and facial obesity hypercatabolic syndrome (thinned skin purple striae ecchymosis bruising with no obvious trauma proximal muscle weakness with amyotrophy osteoporosis) and in children weight gain with decreasing growth velocity.
